headline: Artichoke Stuffed Mushrooms
description: This recipe will deliver tasty mushrooms stuffed with cheese, onion, and artichoke hearts.
name: Artichoke Stuffed Mushrooms
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 (12 ounce) jar marinated artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
0.5 teaspoon garlic salt, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare a baking sheet with cooking spray.

Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook the onions and mushroom stems in the hot oil until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes; season with salt and pepper. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl; add the artichoke hearts, cream cheese, sour cream, Italian cheese blend, and Parmesan cheese. Season with salt, pepper, and garlic salt. Stir the mixture until ingredients are evenly distributed. Stuff the mushroom caps with the mixture. Arrange the stuffed mushrooms on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until the filling begins to bubble, about 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I made these tonight and we loved them. Being a Marylander of course I added blue crab claw meat to the mix that is the only change I made. Next time I will add some old bay. I did have leftover filling but glad I have some, tomorrow I am baking whats left in a mini glass dish for lunch. Thanks for sharing the recipe.

Next time I will not drain off all the liquid off the artichokes. The mushrooms were dry after I had baked them for 20 minutes. They sure did taste good. I will also add only 1/2 the Italian bread crumbs as mine were very dry.
My wife loved them....I did add some minced celery and minced bacon. Outside of that same ingredient used.
this turned out great. My wife loved it. I will make it again.

OH MY!!!!!! These were a hit!!! Even my friend who had to tell me that he hates marinated artichoke hearts couldn't get enough! second time I made them I bought 4 8 oz of button mushrooms, increased the cream cheese, sour cream, garlic salt and cheeses by 1/3, same jar of artichokes. Little left over mixture, but plan on making spinach omelet with it! YUM

I will definitely make again every one loved it
Thank you

Very good but I tried to cut out some of the fat with fat-free cream cheese and substituted sour cream with fat free greek yogurt. Next time I will follow recipe. The marinated artichoke hearts puts a great pulse into this dish
Very good
This is a delicious recipe. I made these for Valentines Day and my husband loved it as much as I did.

The stuffing was enough to fill another batch of mushrooms, and I found it worked better with the second batch where the stuffing had set in the fridge for a day or two. The first batch came out kind of watery and the second batch were nice and firm and taster better.

Because of the artichokesI thought this might be an Americanized version of the Italian stuffed mushrooms I grew up with. Not so much. To me, it's very American and typical mushy with all that cheese. It wasn't terrible, and I could see some people enjoying it, but for me it's a no go.

Because of the artichokesI thought this might be an Americanized version of the Italian stuffed mushrooms I grew up with. Not so much. To me, it's very American and typical mushy with all that cheese. It wasn't terrible, and I could see some people enjoying it, but for me it's a no go.

I made these to bring to a party. They were good but no one oohed and ahed, and there were a few left at the end of the night. I was afraid they would be horrible cold but they still tasted pretty good even after sitting out. I definitely had more filling than I needed but it is good with crackers.

I marinated the artichokes in balsamic vinegar overnight. I sautéed the mushrooms in butter first, and added sautéed onions and garlic to the artichoke cheese mixture. They were a hit, everyone loved them
Delicious recipe!! I’ll keep this one and make it again soon! Loved it!
Made these today and followed the recipe. My husband I loved them so taste! Will be one of my favourites for sure!

They're a bit tedious to make, but so are any stuffed mushrooms. They're a big hit with everyone. My family and friends are always trying to get me to make them. Do remember to briefly prebake the mushroom caps before filling though, otherwise they will get too soggy.

I absolutely love this recipe. We made them on the grill since having a cookout. 
I added frozen spinach, I was looking up recipes and got them mixed up but this ended up being an awesome mix up. Just drain the spinach really well and it was just like spinach artichoke dip!
Perfect just as it is written. Very big crowd pleaser
Great recipe as is......will definitely be making it again this week for Super Bowl Sunday!
Brought these to every holiday gathering this year and been a hit every time. So nice to have something different than the typical stuffed with seafood mushrooms.
Always a hit when I make these. I always get asked for the recipe. Extra filling freezes well to be used as needed Or they can be prepared then frozen, not as good when reheated, but still yummy
We have made this recipe three times now and we love it. I added some Parmesan cheese to the top just to make the tips a little crunchy. We will make it many more times to come!
I love artichokes so this recipe caught my eye. They disappeared from the plate. I baked them in a small size muffin tin. They sit on the edge and the liquid goes in the tin keeping mushroom dry.
These are delicious and so easy to make! I added one package of chopped spinach to the mix as well and used both button mushrooms and baby bella mushrooms.
These were awesome! I followed the recipe to a "T" and they were delicious! They were a hit at the party I brought them to!

I will make this again for sure! I have prepared this appetizer a few times now with "oohs and aahs" but other night I added about a quarter cup of cooked crisp pancetta (minced), I added granulated garlic but no salt. I sautéed the mushroom caps, one side only, filled them and placed them in a tart pan, the small indentations were perfect for holding the mushrooms upright while baking. 
I also did not use "marinated" artichokes and I used hearts because I don't like those little fibers.

I would have to say (all modesty aside) it was one of the best appetizers I have ever enjoyed! 

Try it, you'll like it!

These turned out well for me. I followed the author's suggestions and only used half the cream cheese and added fresh garlic, parsley, and topped with Parmesan and mozzarella cheeses. I threw everything into my food processor because of laziness and I accidentally made a bit of a purée rather than a chunkier filling but that was my rookie mistake. The flavor was great even if the texture left something to be desired (again, my fault). I would definitely give this another go!
Made as written, these are a big hit whenever I serve them. Just delicious!

Wow, these are very good! The only thing I changed due to personal preference was the addition of a little hot sauce and after baking the recommended time I turned on the broiler just to brown the tops a little. Yum-o!!

This made a great quantity. I stored the leftover filling in the fridge, then used some of it again for another get together. I still had a lot of filling left, so I made another pan. Each time I make a batch of 24 it there is none left over.
Great!
We all loved it. No changes to original recipe. Will definitely be making it again.
We loved this recipe prepared just as written. The filling is great on pita and crackers too. thank you for this great appetizer recipe.
these are really good. I followed the recipe but used onion powder instead of real onion for texture reasons. added bacon bits because I had them
These were awesome! I ran out of mushroom to stuff so I put the rest of the filling in the fridge and ate it later with crackers. Delicious!

This was just ok. I think the marinade on the artichokes gave it a bitter taste. I've noticed the same flavor using marinaded artichokes in other recipes. Guess I just don't like that flavor. Maybe I should've rinsed after draining. Probably won't make again.

I had some mushrooms that needed to be used. So I threw these together on the spur of the moment. Hubby loved them.
Made the mushrooms as is without the Parmesan. I liked that these didn't use breadcrumbs or bacon.

The only change I made was to use 8-9 big stuffer caps instead of 24 small mushrooms. These were so, SO good! We each ate two as a main course, and we would have fought over the rest if we hadn't been so full!

The taste of these were pretty good but I didn't like the texture of the filling. It was too mushy/slimy. I think I would prefer no cream cheese and maybe some breadcrumbs for texture. Anyway, my three star review is really a matter of taste. Nothing wrong with the recipe, just not to my liking.
Always requested at gatherings... And I'm not even a very good cook!!
they were a little spicy!

very delicious and easy to make. i cut back on the cream cheese and sour cream, increased the artichoke. I read a review stating that mushrooms excrete too much water. i placed the mushrooms in my skillet added a few droplets of water and put the lid on them. this made the mushrooms tender and no water on my baking sheet. also i topped with a little sprinkle of italian breadcrumbs.

Outstanding recipe! Loved the stuffed mushrooms, but the leftover filling as a warm dip was so creamy and delicious - will definitely use for our next party. The only thing I did different was to add the cream cheese to the onion and mushrooms the last minute of cooking to totally soften it up. For the dip, I added about a 1/2 teaspoon of Italian herb seasoning. Really a terrific recipe, thanks so much for sharing!
Even my daughter who "hates" mushrooms likes this!
These are the most delicious stuffed mushrooms I have ever tasted! I will definitely be making this recipe again. Love it!

Wonderful mushrooms. Take any leftover filling, put it in a small ramekin, top with bread crumbs and bake along with the mushrooms. It makes awesome artichoke dip similar to restaurant quality. Next time I may make extra with a little spinach and hot sauce!
Very tasty, but super annoying to make! Filling each mushroom took forever, in addition to being messy.

This are good but i would suggest using artichoke hearts that are not marinated. You can find them at Trader Joe's in the freezer section. Canned ones are not as good! The marinated ones take over the flavor.
Really enjoyed these. Doubled the recipe and used baby Bellas instead of the mushrooms stated. The guests enjoyed them at a Tapas party. Just a little more "zip" would have been good too.
The flavors are all excellent. Be sure not to undercook the onions (like I did), or you'll end up with a weird crunch. Cook it right and these are perfect.

I love stuffed mushrooms but didn't really care for these. I cut the cream cheese amount in 1/2 and was glad I did because it was plenty. Had to add more/other seasoning than called for to give the stuffing mixture enough flavor. Also, I love onion, but it seemed to over-power the artichoke flavor and that was a disappointment.
This was a hit at a family Christmas Party. I marinated my atrichokes in a special oil that I made. This was delicious. Thanks for sharing.

I made this for some friends and got GREAT reviews. I used about half of the amount of cheese that the recipe calls for just to make it a little bit "healthier." One guy said that he doesn't like mushrooms but he kept going back for more. Side note: I had quite a bit of the stuffing left over after stuffing all of the caps. I just threw the stuffing in a small baking dish and served it with crackers the next day as a snack. Worked great!
Also good without stuffing the mushrooms - just cut up all the mushrooms and make a delicious dip!
This was good, but a bit bland. I believe if I would have added spicy sausage it would have given it the kick it needed.
These are sooo good and sooo easy! We had a TON of filling left, though, so I'd say make sure your mushrooms are pretty large. Or, the filling makes an excellent dip, too!

These were a hit with our guests. I used cremini mushrooms, as they have a nice shape and are flat on the tops so they don't teeter when you stuff and place them in your baking dish. To address some of the reviews about too much liquid coming out, take a spoon and scoop out the "gills", the darker part that fans around the base of the stem. This will solve that problem, unless you have used something in the filling to make them ooze all over. I have to admit I skipped the first part of sauteing the mushroom stems and onions in olive oil. No need to do this, unless you have the time. Since I'm the only one in the kitchen and preparing the entire meal for guests, I opted out on having to chop onion, and an extra pan to clean. Instead I just added some crushed garlic to the mix, along with Alfredo sauce from a jar (which was in the fridge from a prior recipe and I needed to use it)in lieu of the sour cream. This is a beautiful appetizer to present for your guests while awaiting the main course.

This recipe deserves 5 stars. It was such a hit with family. It is so tasty and delicate that I serve this for special dinner parties. Guests think its brilliant! Like I went to culinary school! 
I followed the directions, but used pecorini cheese instead of parmesean because that's what I had in the fridge.
The stuffing is absolutely delicious. I used goat cheese instead of cream cheese and added a little of some pureed kalamata olive and walnuts. I defintely will use this again.

Excellent. I did not have marinated artichokes, only had frozen on hand so I chopped the defrosted artichoke hearts and sauted in the onion/garlic until soft and fragrant. Made an amazing filling for the mushrooms and also was great in some stuffed sweet peppers we made to accompany on the appetizer tray. The way these mushrooms cook with the filling is mouth watering. Yum! Sprinkled some paprika on top for crusting.
These are the best ever! Perfect how they are! I've been serving these as apetizers for years, and they are ALWAYS mouthwatering amazing!
This where great I made them a day ahead then cooked them the next day! REally good

Unbelievable! My go to for many vegetarian recipes because you can play with adding other veggies. I always cut the cream cheese in half and use low fat sour cream and cream cheese. I always use non-marinated artichokes and adjust the seasonings to taste. I have served as a main course and used portabello (using lower oven temps and longer cooking times, or parbaking the mushrooms prior to stuffing). With regard to any leftover filling, I have used (or frozen for later) and used as: quesadilla, burrito, or enchilada innards, baked in phyllo or tart shells, in quiches, baked and served on crackers or chips, in eggs Benedict or breakfast burritos, in pasta sauces or baked pasta dishes -- even veggie lasagna, bruschetta, cheesy garlic bread. Really, you are only constrained by the limits of your own imagination. And it is all absolutely delicious; I have never heard a negative comment and routinely get rave reviews and requests for the recipe. Thank you Anita!!! You must be brilliant!

I made these for my daughter's graduation party and everyone LOVED them. i had 3 people (and there were only about 12 there) ask for the recipe. I mistakenly used one small jar of artichokes instead of the 12 oz. and even though it was good, more artichokes would have been better - I'll pay more attention to the size of ingredients next time!! 
I did mix the parm with some breadcrumbs to sprinkle on top and they browned up nicely and gave the mushrooms a nice little crunch.
I also used fresh garlic vs. garlic salt - tasted and adjusted with a little salt and pepper
Made these as little appetizers for a big family Christmas dinner & they were a hit. Big flavor & nice little presentation.

I made this appetizer for a party at my Mother's...they were all gone in under 5 minutes. My 6 year old nieces even fought over the last one! A little time consuming to make, but followed the recipe to a T and it turned out great!

These were delicious. The only changes I made were I sautéed 3 cloves of garlic after the onion step, added a hint of cayenne pepper to the mixture and used fresh mozzarella in place of the Italian blend cheese. Thank you Anita!
Wowed the in-laws with this recipe on Easter. Very good! Thanks. Next time I'll buy 30 mushrooms because I have extra stuffing.
A little too oily and runny, good flavor though
Great Recipe... Makes plenty of filling so the mushrooms aren't on the skimpy side. I also made this using portabello mushrooms, very tasty!

All those fab reviews were true! These are amazing! I could not stop eating it right out of the bowl!! Simple to make with uncomplicated ingredients, looks so elegant, and tastes good enough to scrape the empty plate....what more could you ask for? If you love mushrooms, you're gonna' love these!
Awesome, everyone loved them as recipe is written. I found mini bella 'shrooms, and they worked wonderful since they have flat tops, and they tasted good.

Truly yum! I added maybe 1/4 cup of Italian seasoned bread crumbs to the filling and topped the shrooms with Parmesan cheese before baking. And I used garlic powder. Really good! We had a few left, as only 3 of us 5 like mushrooms, so I am going to chop them up, add to the leftover filling, thin with a little cream or milk and toss with pasta. Doesn't that sound good? I'm sure it will be. Thanks for the awesome recipe!

I made these today with some tweaks. I used 1/2 the cream cheese, added pieces of pepperoni, a handful of seasoned breadcrumb, and sub-ed mozzarella for Italian blend. I baked the stuffed mushrooms for 35 minutes instead of just 20; this ensured tap hat the mushrooms were cooked and the filling was plenty hot. Overall I give the Recioe 4 stars for a good start on flavor; the texture is a bit off (without the tweaks) as its just mushy. I will make them again and will sprinkle the tops with bread crumb. Thanks Chicago--Anita for sharing this flavorful recipe.
made these twice in one week- i used a lot more mushrooms then recipe asked since the we had so much stuffing left over!! so good, yes they were very oily so be careful when you take out of oven.
WOW! Best stuffed mushrooms ever! Great recipes, my new favorite way to stuff mushrooms.

Great, easy recipe. I made this exactly as the recipe was given, and it came out great. The next time I make it- I believe I will add a bit more garlic or add some garlic to the onions as I saute. I thought this recipe could use a bit more garlic flavor. All in in all-very good!
These were so great! I didn't have any sour cream on hand, but they were great anyway. I had more than enough stuffing so I make about 35 mushrooms with this recipe
Made these the other night and they were great. Very rich....may try a little less cream cheese next time I make them.
These were delicious!
My boyfriend and I really enjoyed these!! He has asked me to save the recipe to make sure I make them again!! I used the leftover stuffing as a dip and it was great!!
I enjoyed this recipe, but it didn't have that wow factor for me. I did end up with a lot of left over stuffing, so buy extra mushrooms. I didn't make any adjustments to the recipe.
This was a great recipe, and the extra "stuffing" makes a great warm chip dip!
Absolutely wonderful. Everyone raved & was asking for the recipe. I'm sure that I'll be asked to make them again.
Easy to follow instructions with ingredients that you will likely have at home already. Very tasty and I didn't have the best artichokes or the right cheese for the recipe. Thanks!

These were WONDERFUL. I made these as an appetizer before my family went to meet friends for a Christmas dinner, and we really enjoyed them. Like others, I added minced garlic instead of garlic salt, cut the cream cheese in half and didn't miss it, and added a touch of extra asiago cheese because it sounded good. Num, num, nummy. Thanks for a great recipe.

The taste of these stuffed mushrooms was great. My only problem was after baking there was too much liquid in the pan. I think the mushrooms extract a lot of liquid when cooking in the oven. My solution is to try and add some seasoned breadcrumbs. Wondering if anyone else had that problem.
I made this for the first time as appetizers for Thanksgiving and followed the recipe to a "T". They were a hit and were gone within minutes!! I only got 2! Definitely will make this again! Thanks!!

I will be making a test run of these in the next two days for Thanksgiving. I plan on trying a variety of cheese, and I'm hoping to cut the cream cheese completely. So, parmesan only, parmesan and feta, feta only, blue cheese only... Mine might just turn into a different recipe!

Loved it! I actually put it on top of the large portabella caps and I chopped up some small mushrooms and added them to the onions I also used fresh garlic and added some Italian seasoned bread crumbs on top. The left over is awesome for a cracker dip!

Cut cream cheese amount in half and still very mushy. Ended up broiling at the end of cooking to crisp up a tad. I will not only drain but also squeeze the artichokes in paper towels. Draining left too much juice in them. I browned mushrooms on the bottom as one user suggested and that flattened them out sufficiently-no need to trim.

Great recipe. I didn't have sour cream though and just used motz cheese, didn't have an Italian blend. Loved them and will be making these for an upcoming family gathering. My husband couldn't eat them fast enough. Thanks for the delicious recipe.

I found these to be very bland, I added a TON of salt and green chilies and that helped. I had made these for a dinner party and heard several of the guests complaining about the onions and bad breath, all in all I would not make these again.

Just made these for the first time, only change was non-marinated artichokes (on hand), and they were pretty good. Put filling in both small phylo cups and mushrooms; mushrooms were much better than the cups as the filling is actually kind of bland. 1/2 batch made enough for 8 med/big mushrooms and 12 cups. I will be making these again, but I'll add some herbs, more S&P, and use the right chokes. Could even see some lemon, maybe a bit of crumbled sausage, or as another reviewer suggested, spinach would be good addition.This is a good base that provides a nice springboard for going in several different directions.
I can't believe I never rated this recipe, we LOVE it. I ended up with extra filing, but it was okay because I had more mushrooms :). My only complaint is I didn't make enough :)

These were fantastic! The recipe made way more stuffing than needed, which was good because I was eating it out of the bowl before I ever started filling the mushrooms. I used ordinary canned artichoke hearts instead of marinated, and it still tasted great. Excellent recipe!

These were absolutely delicious and so simple to make!!!!
I altered the ingrediants.
I used 2oz of cream cheese instead and added monteray jack cheese.
I also put roasted red peppers on top and tossed them in the oven! the peppers gave it a pop!

The filling is great. I think next time I will just make it into a dip and not put it on mushrooms. I love mushrooms but I really didn't think the mushrooms complemented the filling. Or, maybe I'll just use smaller mushrooms?
